intro: Pleuranthodium floribundum, commonly known as the clustered pleuranthodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface.
